verses.verse: "Surely <S%H3426><s%> there is a mine <S%H4161><s%> for silver, <S%H3701><s%> and a place <S%H4725><s%> for gold <S%H2091><s%> which they refine. <S%H2212><s%>
Iron <S%H1270><s%> is taken <S%H3947><s%> out of the earth, <S%H6083><s%> and copper <S%H5154><s%> is smelted <S%H6694><s%> out of the ore. <S%H68><s%>

Man sets <S%H7760><s%> an end <S%H7093><s%> to darkness, <S%H2822><s%> and searches out, <S%H2713><s%> to the furthest bound, <S%H8503><s%> the stones <S%H68><s%> of obscurity <S%H652><s%> and of thick darkness. <S%H6757><s%>

He breaks open <S%H6555><s%> a shaft <S%H5158><s%> away from where people live. <S%H1481><s%> They are forgotten <S%H7911><s%> by the foot. <S%H7272><s%> They hang <S%H1809><s%> far <S%H5128><s%> from men, <S%H582><s%> they swing back and forth.
As for the earth, <S%H776><s%> out of it comes <S%H3318><s%> bread; <S%H3899><s%> Underneath it is turned up <S%H2015><s%> as it were by fire. <S%H784><s%>
Sapphires <S%H5601><s%> come <S%H4725><s%> from its rocks. <S%H68><s%> It has dust <S%H6083><s%> of gold. <S%H2091><s%>
That path <S%H5410><s%> no bird <S%H5861><s%> of prey knows, <S%H3045><s%> neither has the falcon <S%H344><s%>'s eye <S%H5869><s%> seen it. <S%H7805><s%>
The proud <S%H7830><s%> animals <S%H1121><s%> have not trodden <S%H1869><s%> it, <S%H7826><s%> nor has the fierce lion passed by there. <S%H5710><s%>
He puts forth <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> on the flinty rock, <S%H2496><s%> and he overturns <S%H2015><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> by the roots. <S%H8328><s%>
He cuts out <S%H1234><s%> channels <S%H2975><s%> among the rocks. <S%H6697><s%> His eye <S%H5869><s%> sees <S%H7200><s%> every precious thing. <S%H3366><s%>
He binds <S%H2280><s%> the streams <S%H5104><s%> that they don't <S%H1065><s%> trickle. The thing that is hidden <S%H8587><s%> he brings forth <S%H3318><s%> to light. <S%H216><s%>
"But where <S%H370><s%> shall wisdom <S%H2451><s%> be found? <S%H4672><s%> Where is the place <S%H4725><s%> of understanding? <S%H998><s%>
Man <S%H582><s%> doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know its price; <S%H6187><s%> Neither is it found <S%H4672><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living. <S%H2416><s%>
The deep <S%H8415><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3220><s%> 'It isn't in me.' The sea says, <S%H559><s%> 'It isn't with me.'
It can't <S%H5414><s%> be gotten for gold, <S%H5458><s%> neither shall silver <S%H3701><s%> be weighed <S%H8254><s%> for its price. <S%H4242><s%>
It can't <S%H5541><s%> be valued with the gold <S%H3800><s%> of Ophir, <S%H211><s%> with the precious <S%H3368><s%> onyx, <S%H7718><s%> or the sapphire. <S%H5601><s%>
Gold <S%H2091><s%> and glass <S%H2137><s%> can't <S%H6186><s%> equal it, <S%H8545><s%> neither shall it be exchanged for jewels <S%H3627><s%> of fine gold. <S%H6337><s%>
No mention <S%H2142><s%> shall be made of coral <S%H7215><s%> or of crystal. <S%H1378><s%> Yes, <S%H4901><s%> the price of wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is above rubies. <S%H6443><s%>
The topaz <S%H6357><s%> of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> shall not equal <S%H6186><s%> it, <S%H5541><s%> Neither shall it be valued with pure <S%H2889><s%> gold. <S%H3800><s%>
Where <S%H370><s%> then does wisdom <S%H2451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> from? <S%H4725><s%> Where is the place of understanding? <S%H998><s%>
Seeing it is hidden <S%H5956><s%> from the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of all living, <S%H2416><s%> and kept close <S%H5641><s%> from the birds <S%H5775><s%> of the sky. <S%H8064><s%>
Destruction <S%H11><s%> and Death <S%H4194><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H8085><s%> 'We have heard a rumor <S%H8088><s%> of it with our ears. <S%H241><s%>'
"God <S%H430><s%> understands <S%H995><s%> its way, <S%H1870><s%> and he knows <S%H3045><s%> its place. <S%H4725><s%>
For he looks <S%H5027><s%> to the ends <S%H7098><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> and sees <S%H7200><s%> under the whole sky. <S%H8064><s%>
He establishes the force of the wind. <S%H7307><s%> Yes, <S%H8505><s%> he measures out the waters <S%H4325><s%> by measure. <S%H4060><s%>
When he made <S%H6213><s%> a decree <S%H2706><s%> for the rain, <S%H4306><s%> and a way <S%H1870><s%> for the lightning <S%H2385><s%> of the thunder; <S%H6963><s%>
then he saw <S%H7200><s%> it, <S%H5608><s%> and declared it. <S%H3559><s%> He established it, <S%H2713><s%> yes, and searched it out.

To man <S%H120><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3374><s%> 'Behold, the fear of the Lord, <S%H136><s%> that is wisdom. <S%H2451><s%> To depart <S%H5493><s%> from evil <S%H7451><s%> is understanding. <S%H998><s%>'"
